SENT.plain: Of 58 consecutive patients with spontaneous CSF leaks, nine exhibited features of connective tissue disorder

Five additional patients had hyperflexible joints, of whom four had arachnodactyly, four were tall and slender, two had hyperextensible skin, and one had a strong family history of abdominal aorta aneurysms
Retinal detachment at a young age was noted in two
One patient had bilateral carotid dissections
A dural weakness may predispose patients to spontaneous CSF leak
